description.narrative: Government and partners have capacity to scale up improved service delivery at community and facility level sanitation and hygiene especially for the most deprived communities

sector.narrative: Child marriage - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
HSS - Risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Sanitation - eliminating open defecation in peri-urban and urban communities
Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
WASH - risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Water supply - rural communities service delivery

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities disaster prevention and preparedness
Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in India (Adolescent Development and Participation)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2017 India: Reducing Stunting in Children Under Five Years of Age: a comprehensive evaluation of UNICEF’s strategies and programme performance – India Country Case Study
India 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
India Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government and partners have capacity to scale up improved service delivery at community and facility level sanitation and hygiene especially for the most deprived communities

description.narrative: The Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) programme has supported government and stakeholders to develop knowledge products that influenced decision-making at the national and state levels, and the output has achieved its target. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/01/2018

title.narrative: Key national and state policies, strategies, and plans are evidence-based and reflect an analysis of current issues

target.value: 2016:3 national and state policies, strategies, and plans are evidence-based reflecting an analysis of current issues

title.narrative: No. of WASH knowledge and information products incorporated into government and partner data and KM systems and dissemination pathways
